Key Match Events: DeMar DeRozan had his fourth straight game with at least 20 points to start his time with the Kings.
Behind Fox's 10 points, they outscored the Jazz 29-14 in the third quarter, including a 14-2 run to end the period.
Post-Match Reflections: Only Chris Webber (seven games, Feb. 5-17, 1999) and Oscar Robertson (six games, Oct. 19-27, 1960) have had longer streaks to start their tenures with the franchise.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings shot just 25.8% from 3-point range but hit 65.6% inside the arc.
DeRozan had his fourth straight game with at least 20 points to start his time with the Kings.

Without defensive stopper Hendricks, who was lost for the season with a gruesome broken leg and dislocated ankle on Monday, Utah struggled with Sacramento's dribble penetration and crisp passing while often having three or four rookies and second-year players on the floor.
